101.description: The Firebase JavaScript SDK can be used for more than just web apps, since it supports running in Node.js, ReactNative, and Cordova. In this talk, you'll learn how to design and structure a Firebase application that can be re-purposed to multiple platforms (web, server, and mobile clients). We'll walk through the development of an application data model and schema for a sample app including how you can test it in a platform-independent way. We will then show how to package the UI for the app to run in multiple platform environments.
101.title: Cross-platform App Development with Firebase

102.description: You've written an application and now the worst thing that can happen to you has come about - People are using it! You now have load spikes to deal with. You can scale up to deal with the excess traffic, but what do you do when your load is variable? How do you do that, and stay on budget? This session is a case study on getting an App Engine app to scale to serve 30,000,000 requests an hour. It will take you through the architecture, the code changes and the technology trade offs to get to that level of traffic.
102.title: Serving 30,000,000 Requests an Hour in the Cloud
